idAbs.para: The Collect Values tool is designed to collect output values of an iterator, or to convert a list of multivalues into a single input. The output of Collect Values can be used as input to tools like Merge, Append, Mosaic, and Cell Statistics.

summary.para: The Collect Values tool is designed to collect output values of an iterator, or to convert a list of multivalues into a single input. The output of Collect Values can be used as input to tools like Merge, Append, Mosaic, and Cell Statistics.

bullet_item.para: This tool is intended for use in ModelBuilder and not in Python scripting.

para.para: All the tools in ArcGIS are empty (without color) when added in a model except Collect Values and Merge Branch. Unlike other system tools, Collect Values is always a ready-to-run state (colored in). This is because the input to Collect Values is a multiple value data type, and an empty multiple value is considered a valid input.
